properties.address: Unit 5 Old Shawbridge Sawmill, Lancashire, Lancashire BB7 1LY
properties.description: Bowland Bikes CIC crowdfunding site is now LIVE with matched funding projects and a warm spaces grant from Lancashire County Council We provide not only a friendly service, but a sanctuary, its why our staff, hub users and guests voted to provide mental health first aider training for example. During the pandemic, the local community needed a venue for some quiet time, or a chat with staff or visitors in a safe, warm location, telling us that they didn’t feel they could relax / or be safe, anywhere else. As a result, we then started to uptick our community based work, creating an official “Warm Space” under Lancashire County Council’s scheme, we are now busy raising funds, seeking partners, sponsorship and grants to provide this facility for more days, longer hours, and to provide healthy hot food & drink.
properties.title: Bowland Bikes CIC

properties.address: Queen Street Mill Textile Museum, Lancashire BB10 2HX
properties.description: The days are dark, the rain is heavy and the wind is whipping. We can't think of a better time to cosy up in an iconic museum, and enjoy a range of hot teas and coffees, delicious food and snacks, and free access to books, board games and crafts. Our Community Cafe will be open Wednesdays and Thursdays throughout the winter to give all visitors a warm, safe space to enjoy a rest from the wild weather and seasonal shopping. Take a break and play a game or two. Enjoy relaxing in the unique atmosphere of the last surviving steam-powered weaving mill in the world. Free entry to the cafe, charges applicable for food and drink.
properties.title: Queen Street Mill Textile Museum

properties.title: St Peters Centre.

properties.description:
We have a small inside cafe area where you can enjoy tea, coffee, cold drinks, hot chocolate, biscuits, home made cake, toast and soup. Its is bright and cheery, obviously things to read are about gardenling and wildlife. You can also sit in our classroom, draw, paint, play cards, read a book etc. We have a jolly bunch of volunteers that come for social company and some come to garden, no pressure, all ages welcome.
We can put you in touch with people to support with financial problems or benefits claims. We can advise people and how easy it is to grow and cook your own food, how beneficial getting out in green spaces is
BUS: Light refreshments are free to all our members and visitors.
CHARGES: Free of Charge when visitors mention warm hearts
properties.title: Fennyfold Community Garden

properties.address:
Down Town (above New Look in Burnley town centre) 28 Market Promenade, Charter Walk Shopping Centre, Burnley, 01282 686402
BB11 1AE
properties.description:
A warm, welcoming hub of activity, specialist support available, and free courses and social events. We have a cafe, winter warming clothing and school uniform shop, community grocery and food parcels. We have a Pay-It Forward scheme available in both our café and our grocery should emergency food be needed. We also have a piano, a book swap, and arts and crafts activities available for all ages.
Burnley Together staff will be able to help you and signpost to specialist agencies. As well as our social groups, we also have a range of support covering the following areas: employment, debt, advocacy, mental health, health and wellbeing, benefit forms, financial advice, home improvement, infant massage, young people’s support, LGBTQ+ support, and citizen’s advice. And we have a Complex Needs Support worker who is able to coordinate support for our customers who have high / complex needs.
BUS: Burnley bus station is a 5 minute walk away
CHARGES: Free school uniform and a small donation (between £1 and £3) for warm winter clothes. Warm Winter clothing can be provided free of charge at the discretion of Burnley Together staff. Food parcels are available free of charge (1 per month), and shops are available in our community grocery (starts at £5 per shop for 12 points). Warm drinks can be provided free of charge with funding via our warm spaces grant, and this is primarily for anyone who is homeless, older adults, or anyone struggling with their mental health.
properties.title: Down Town

Shower also available. We offer signposting to other services, help with computers and accessing the Internet.
